citations.desc: Institutional Animal Care and Use Committee (IACUC).
citations.narrative:
At the time of the inspection on August 16, 2023, post-procedural care was not provided in accordance with the approved
protocol for chinchilla #23-2-13. Protocol R22-007 states that: “The second post-recovery pain assessment will be
performed 2-3 hours after the chinchilla is returned to the cage… All animals will additionally be monitored by LAR staff
and LAR veterinarian.” Chinchilla #23-2-13 was used in a procedure on 8-15-23. There was an immediate post-procedure
pain assessment recorded on the Procedure and Anesthetic Record, but the required 2-3 hours post-procedure
assessment was left blank. This assessment should have been documented on the record and should have occurred
between 8:30-9:30 pm to be following the protocol. Notably, there was a completed record of daily observation for the
next day on 8-16-2023.
Adhering to the protocol is essential to detect and treat pain in animals especially 2-3 hours post-procedure. Animals
assessed immediately post-procedure may not be recovered enough from general anesthesia to show symptoms of pain.
Hence, there is a second required post-procedure pain assessment 2-3 hours afterward. Animals not recorded as being
assessed could be experiencing pain and showing symptoms but if no one does it or records it on the Procedure and
Anesthetic Record and no pain-alleviating medications are recorded or given, then the IACUC cannot be assured that the
animals are not experiencing pain nor are they being treated with the appropriate analgesics as required.
Significant changes regarding the care and use of animals in ongoing activities must be approved by the IACUC before
being implemented or practiced.
Correct by 8-17-2023.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives.
